enGB: You may use your {g}Strength{/g} modifier in place of your {g}Dexterity{/g} modifier for your attack rolls when making a ranged attack with thrown weapons. You may also use the Power Attack feat instead of the Deadly Aim feat when attacking with thrown weapons.

At 4th level, a horse gains Str +2 and Con +2 and its hoof attacks become primary.
When riding a horse, you gain a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to AC and on attack rolls against enemies of Medium size or smaller.

Reddit's own character class. CHA TO EVERYTHING! 
Basically Fighter class with +CHA to all stats and CHA spellcasting. (This is a meme class I made, don't take it too seriously)

Swordmasters are proficient with all simpe and martial swords, plut the quarterstaff. They are proficient with light armor, but not with shields.
You gain two wing attacks. These are secondary natural attacks that each deal 2d8 damage
A swordmaster meditates to strengthen her spiritual connection to her blade. She strives to perfect her skills by mastering six deadly trances.
A swordmaster meditates to strengthen her spiritual connection to her blade. She strives to perfect her skills by mastering six deadly trances.
At 3rd level, the swordmaster chooses one trance from the list below. She chooses another trance at 6th, 9th, 12th, 15th, and 18th level. She can only use one type of trance at a time.
The swordmaster’s blade rises and falls with the graceful sweeping arcs of the mountain crane. When in this trance, a swordmaster gains the benefits of the Crane Style feat.
The swordmaster’s blade rises and falls with the graceful sweeping arcs of the mountain crane. When in this trance, a swordmaster gains the benefits of the Crane Style feat.

Like the dragon, the swordmaster has honed the steadiness of her mind and body. When in this trance, a swordmaster gains the benefits of the Dragon Style feat.
Like the dragon, the swordmaster has honed the steadiness of her mind and body. When in this trance, a swordmaster gains the benefits of the Dragon Style feat.

Using the swiftness of the leopard, a swordmaster’s evasive footwork confuses her opponents. When in this trance, a swordmaster gains the benefits of the Mobility feat.
Using the swiftness of the leopard, a swordmaster’s evasive footwork confuses her opponents. When in this trance, a swordmaster gains the benefits of the Mobility feat.
Using the swiftness of the leopard, a swordmaster’s evasive footwork confuses her opponents. When in this trance, a swordmaster gains the benefits of the Mobility feat.
As the monkey springs, the swordmaster leaps from the reach of her enemies. While in this trance, a swordmaster gains the benefits of the Trip feat and Fury's Fall feat.
As the monkey springs, the swordmaster leaps from the reach of her enemies. While in this trance, a swordmaster gains the benefits of the Trip feat and Fury's Fall feat.

Like the serpent, the swordmaster’s quick movements allow her to catch her opponent unawares. While in this trance, a swordmaster gains the benefits of the Feint feat with a +4 bonus to Feint.
Like the serpent, the swordmaster’s quick movements allow her to catch her opponent unawares. While in this trance, a swordmaster gains the benefits of the Feint feat with a +4 bonus to Feint.
Like the serpent, the swordmaster’s quick movements allow her to catch her opponent unawares. While in this trance, a swordmaster gains the benefits of the Feint feat with a +4 bonus to Feint.
The swordmaster pounces upon her opponents, striking with the ferocity and brute force of a wild tiger. While in this trance, a swordmaster gains the benefits of the Pounce feat.
The swordmaster pounces upon her opponents, striking with the ferocity and brute force of a wild tiger. While in this trance, a swordmaster gains the benefits of the Pounce feat.

Adds Perception and Mobility to list of class skills. She also is able to use her curse to qualify for feats that require lycanthropy.
Allows the Swordmaster to enter 2 trances at a time

A blast of heavenfire blazes from your hands. You can fire one ray, plus one additional ray for every 4 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} beyond 11th (to a maximum of three rays at 19th level). Each ray requires a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per caster level (maximum 15d6). Half the damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, but the other half results directly from holy power and is therefore not subject to being reduced by fire {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g}.
You unleash a massive blast of energy that detonates upon all in the AoE, dealing 20d6 fire, 20d6 acid, 20d6 electrical and 20d6 sonic damage. A reflex save halves damage.
Grants you a new powerful spell called Hellbell, which does 10d6 damage of multiple elements! Requires being able to cast spell level 9.

The hematite head of this +1 earth breaker crackles with electricity, dealing an additional 1d6 points of electricity and 1d6 points of sonic damage on each hit. 3 times per day, Storval's Thunder can call down a thunder clap on an enemy. If they fail a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 20 Fortitude save, they are stunned for one round.
Deals an additional 1d6 points of electricity and 1d6 points of sonic damage on each hit.
Gives you +1 bonus to both crit range and crit multiplier. (Gives these bonuses for all weapons/unarmed, despite needing Improved Crit & Improved Crit Mythic)
3 times per day, Storval's Thunder can call down a thunder clap on an enemy. If they fail a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 20 Fortitude save, they are stunned for one round. (period for Hero of Cows)

This metal +1 klar is shaped like the head of a storm roc, whose sharp feathers serve as the klar’s spikes, and it hums and crackles like a distant stormy sky. When used to make a shield bash attack, a Storval’s fang deals an additional 1d6 points of sonic damage. In addition, the wielder gains electricity resistance 10.
If the wielder of a Storval’s Fang also wields a Storval’s Thunder and uses the Thunder and Fang feat, Storval’s Thunder deals an additional 2d6 points of electricity damage and the DCs to negate their critical hit effects increase by 5.

If the wielder of a Storval’s Fang also wields a Storval’s Thunder and uses the Thunder and Fang feat, Storval’s Thunder deals an additional 2d6 points of electricity damage and the DCs to negate their critical hit effects increase by 5.
Ring of Tomek, the Eternally Green. His hatred is so skilled, that his ring adds your CHA modifier to your AC as a Profane bonus.
Ring of Tomek, the Eternally Green. His hatred is so skilled, that his ring adds your CHA modifier to your AC as a Profane bonus.

The shining sun of Sarenrae, the twinkling stars of Desna, and the shimmering rainbow of Shelyn come together to form the Radiant Prism, a relatively small pantheon worshipped by those who actively fight against evil to protect the innocent. These three goddesses have been romantically involved with one another from time to time, so it makes sense that they would form a coalition. In addition to defeating the wicked, the Radiant Prism promotes the creation of beautiful works of art to bring more grace to the world.
Though devotees of the Radiant Prism are tasked with battling all sources of evil, they are encouraged to refrain from becoming ruthless butchers. The wicked must be offered the chance to capitulate once it becomes clear their defeat is inevitable. Sarenrae’s compassion is a major pillar of the pantheon, and priests of the Radiant Prism attempt to redeem their enemies where possible. Of course, some creatures are remorseless in their evil (such as fiends and some undead), and the Radiant Prism doesn’t expect their worshippers to waste their lives trying to save such beings.

The ring is imbued with the hope that having a heavy body will make your attacks better.
Adds your CON bonus to your Critical range.
With your Mythic PowerTM, you can now add your Dex bonus to your attack's damage with long bows and short bows, replacing your Str bonus.

Strongman's Necklace make's it's user's skin as tough as their Strength!
Adds STR bonus to DR.
Allows the wearer to cast For The King.

You've learned a way to increase the number of uses of your All is Darkness ability.
Benefit: You can use All is Darnkess a number of additional times per day equal to half your mythic rank.
